title: MPC Kinetic IPO pulled after bookbuild
text:
Coal seam gas services business MPC Kinetic's initial public offering has been pulled.

It is understood the company's owners opted to shelve the listing plans after they were not satisfied with the quality of the book allocation.

It comes after MPC Kinetic ran a bookbuild to sell shares to fund managers on Thursday and even re-priced and restructured the deal late in the day to try and get it away.

However, in the end owners SCF Partners and Viburnum Funds opted to pull the deal.

The failed deal is a poor sign for other IPO contenders in the pipeline, with about half a dozen chunky floats scheduled for the coming two months.

It remains to be seen whether the two investors have another plan for the business.
description: Coal seam gas services business MPC Kinetic's initial public offering has been pulled.
